memes.name: Drake Hotline Bling
memes.semantic_description: Two stacked panels of rapper Drake in an orange puffer jacket on a flat yellow background, where the top panel shows him turning away with a disgusted expression to reject one option and the bottom panel shows him smiling and pointing approvingly at a different option. This template is used to contrast a bad or outdated choice with a preferred or upgraded alternative, visually encoding a clear before/after preference.

memes.name: Two Buttons
memes.semantic_description: Vertical comic-style image where the top shows two red buttons side by side, each representing a different option, and the bottom shows a sweating cartoon man in a red shirt wiping his forehead in panic as he tries to decide which button to press. This template is used to depict someone torn between two equally problematic or tempting choices, emphasizing indecision, pressure, and the stress of mutually exclusive options.

memes.name: Distracted Boyfriend
memes.semantic_description: Stock photo on a sunny city street where a young man turns his head to stare admiringly at a passing woman in red while his girlfriend, holding his hand, glares at him in shock and outrage. This template encodes a three-way relationship between a current commitment, a new distraction, and the person shifting attention, and is used to show people or entities abandoning their existing priority in favor of a more attractive but often shallow alternative.

memes.name: Bernie I Am Once Again Asking For Your Support
memes.semantic_description: Outdoor shot of Bernie Sanders in a winter coat, scarf, and gloves, looking earnestly into the camera on a quiet suburban street. The template is used to represent someone who keeps coming back with the same request, demand, or reminder—often about attention, money, help, or behavior—highlighting repetition, persistence, and mild exasperation at having to ask yet again.

memes.name: Running Away Balloon
memes.semantic_description: Tall five-panel comic where a child accidentally lets go of a balloon and watches it float away into the sky, initially reacting with sadness and sense of loss, but later reframing the situation by imagining the balloon joyfully escaping. The template is used to show a narrative that starts from a negative interpretation of an event and ends with a more positive or philosophical perspective, ideal for explaining emotional reframing or personal growth over multiple beats.

memes.name: Left Exit 12 Off Ramp
memes.semantic_description: Highway photo where a blue car violently swerves across lanes to take a sharp left exit while the overhead sign shows the straight-ahead route and the left exit labeled differently. This template represents someone abruptly abandoning their sensible or expected path to pursue a more impulsive, chaotic, or tempting alternative, perfect for highlighting last‑minute decisions and irrational pivots.

memes.name: UNO Draw 25 Cards
memes.semantic_description: Two-panel photo where the first panel shows an UNO card on the table forcing a player to either do an action or draw 25 cards, and the second panel shows a man smugly holding an absurd number of cards, clearly choosing the extreme punishment over complying. This template captures stubbornness, pettiness, or commitment to a bad habit even when an easier option exists.

memes.name: Epic Handshake
memes.semantic_description: Cropped still of two extremely muscular forearms from different men gripping each other in a firm handshake, veins bulging, in front of a blurred background. The template is used to label two very different groups or ideas on the arms that nonetheless strongly agree on a specific shared point labeled at the handshake, highlighting unlikely alliances or unexpected common ground.

memes.name: Disaster Girl
memes.semantic_description: Photo of a young girl in the foreground glancing at the camera with a subtle smirk while a house burns fiercely in the background, fire trucks and smoke visible. This template suggests someone taking credit for or enjoying chaos, used for scenarios where a person’s actions indirectly cause a disaster or where they are unbothered by a mess unfolding behind them.

memes.name: Gru's Plan
memes.semantic_description: Four-panel sequence from Despicable Me where Gru proudly presents a multi‑step plan on a flipchart, grinning as he points to the first two panels, only for the third panel to reveal an unexpected or self‑defeating outcome, leaving him in the last panel staring in stunned silence. This template is perfect for describing plans that unintentionally sabotage themselves or reveal an embarrassing final step.

memes.name: Always Has Been
memes.semantic_description: Stylized panel of two astronauts in space suits looking at Earth from behind; one notices a surprising truth about what they’re seeing, while the other stands behind pointing a gun at them with the realization that it “always has been” that way. The template is used to show someone discovering a shocking fact and another person revealing that this has secretly been true all along, often for meta or cynical truths.

memes.name: Sad Pablo Escobar
memes.semantic_description: Three scenes from Narcos featuring Pablo Escobar alone—sitting on a swing, standing by a pool, and sitting at a table—each with a blank, distant expression in otherwise calm surroundings. This template conveys emptiness, boredom, and endless waiting, typically used to dramatize how long someone has been waiting for a response, update, or event.

memes.name: Anakin Padme 4 Panel
memes.semantic_description: Four-panel Star Wars meme where Anakin confidently makes a statement, Padme smiles and follows up with a clarifying question, and in the final pair of panels her expression turns worried when she realizes he never considered the problematic implication of what he said. This template is used to highlight naive optimism or overconfidence that collapses when someone asks the critical follow‑up question.

memes.name: Waiting Skeleton
memes.semantic_description: Image of a skeleton in tattered clothes sitting on a bench or chair in a grassy area, leaning on one arm as if it has been waiting there for ages. This template exaggerates the length of time someone has been waiting for something to happen, from replies and downloads to life goals and promises.

memes.name: Change My Mind
memes.semantic_description: Photo of a man (Steven Crowder) sitting behind a foldout table on a campus-like sidewalk, with a sign in front inviting people to disagree with his bold printed statement and 'Change My Mind'. The template is used to present a strong or controversial opinion as if it were a provocative challenge, inviting arguments while implying stubborn confidence.

memes.name: Woman Yelling At Cat
memes.semantic_description: Side‑by‑side composite where the left shows a blonde woman sobbing and screaming across a dinner table while being restrained, and the right shows a white cat sitting at a table looking unimpressed at a plate of food. This meme template represents an emotional, over‑the‑top argument on one side and a deadpan, unbothered reaction on the other, ideal for mismatched intensity between two parties.

memes.name: Marked Safe From
memes.semantic_description: Static graphic mimicking Facebook’s 'Marked Safe' notification, with a blue flag icon and text layout declaring safety from some event. This template is used to ironically mark oneself as safe from trends, memes, disasters, or annoyances, framing them as catastrophes you’ve successfully avoided.

memes.name: Batman Slapping Robin
memes.semantic_description: Classic comic panel where Batman forcefully slaps Robin mid-sentence, cutting him off while Robin’s head is whipped to the side. The template is used when one idea or statement (Robin) is being harshly corrected or shut down by a more 'correct' or unforgiving counterpoint (Batman), ideal for calling out naive takes.

memes.name: X, X Everywhere
memes.semantic_description: Scene from Toy Story where Buzz Lightyear gestures expansively into the distance while Woody stares ahead with a distressed expression. This template is used to highlight that a certain phenomenon, problem, or meme is present “everywhere,” often with a mix of amazement and horror.

memes.name: Buff Doge vs. Cheems
memes.semantic_description: Side‑by‑side Doge meme where a hyper‑muscular, upright Doge on the left represents a strong, heroic or idealized version, contrasted with a small, anxious‑looking Cheems dog on the right representing a weak, compromised, or modern version. Often split into top/bottom to show 'then vs now' or 'X vs Y' in terms of strength, competence, or seriousness.

memes.name: Mocking Spongebob
memes.semantic_description: Crouched SpongeBob with bent arms and a contorted face, eyes pointing in different directions and mouth open mid‑word, captured mid‑mock. The template pairs a statement with a distorted 'mocking' version of the same text to imitate someone parroting another’s words in a derisive, sarcastic tone.

memes.name: Trade Offer
memes.semantic_description: Vertical image of a long‑haired man in a purple suit standing in front of a geometric background, hands clasped as if making a formal business proposition. Text typically labels 'I receive' on one side and 'You receive' on the other, describing a lopsided or humorous trade, making this template ideal for mocking unfair deals and exploitative exchanges.

memes.name: Tuxedo Winnie The Pooh
memes.semantic_description: Two horizontal images of Winnie the Pooh: the first shows him slouched in his red shirt with a neutral expression; the second shows him in a tuxedo with a smug, satisfied look. This template is used to show a basic or crude version of something versus a refined, fancy, or over‑engineered version representing the same concept in a 'fancier' way.

memes.name: Success Kid
memes.semantic_description: Close‑up of a toddler on a beach in a green and white shirt, fist clenched with a determined expression as if celebrating a small win. The template expresses satisfaction at overcoming minor obstacles or enjoying small, everyday victories.

memes.name: Y'all Got Any More Of That
memes.semantic_description: Image of a man in a beanie and red jacket scratching his neck, leaning forward with desperate eyes and a pleading expression. The template represents craving or addiction to something—content, features, snacks, or attention—and is used to dramatize an intense need for more.

memes.name: Bernie Sanders Once Again Asking
memes.semantic_description: Poster‑like crop of Bernie Sanders in his winter coat standing outdoors, framed with empty space for text that emphasizes his recurring line 'I am once again asking…'. This cleaner graphic version is optimized for overlaying repeated pleas or reminders, such as asking for updates, feedback, or money again and again.

memes.name: Expanding Brain
memes.semantic_description: Vertical stack of four increasingly dramatic images of brains, starting from a normal brain scan and evolving into glowing, cosmic, over‑the‑top visuals. Each level is captioned with a different idea, representing a progression from simple or naive thinking to absurdly 'enlightened' or overcomplicated 'galaxy brain' takes.

memes.name: One Does Not Simply
memes.semantic_description: Still from Lord of the Rings showing Boromir leaning forward, hand raised in emphasis, mid‑speech. The template is used to reject the idea that something is simple or trivial by starting with 'One does not simply…', ideal for highlighting tasks that outsiders underestimate.

memes.name: Bike Fall
memes.semantic_description: Three-panel comic of a stick‑figure man happily riding a bike, then intentionally jamming a stick in his own front wheel, crashing to the ground, and finally lying on the ground blaming someone or something else. It’s used to show self‑sabotage and the tendency to externalize blame for problems created by one’s own actions.

memes.name: I Bet He's Thinking About Other Women
memes.semantic_description: Bedroom scene with a couple lying back‑to‑back in bed; the woman looks troubled and overthinking while the man stares into the distance. The template contrasts the woman’s imagined deep or romantic concerns about what he’s thinking with the man’s often trivial or random actual thoughts, ideal for showing mismatched assumptions.

memes.name: Ancient Aliens
memes.semantic_description: Close‑up of the Ancient Aliens TV host with wild hair and a knowing expression, hands gesturing toward the viewer. The template is associated with attributing any unexplained event or phenomenon to 'aliens,' and is used to mock conspiracy‑level explanations or overblown theories.

memes.name: 0 days without (Lenny, Simpsons)
memes.semantic_description: Simpsons‑style scene of a factory safety sign reading '0 DAYS WITHOUT AN ACCIDENT' with a worker standing nearby. The template is used to show that some failure, incident, or embarrassment happens so frequently that the counter is constantly reset, emphasizing recurring problems.

memes.name: Mother Ignoring Kid Drowning In A Pool
memes.semantic_description: Four‑panel pool scene where a child is shown drowning and reaching for help while a woman lounges nearby, paying attention elsewhere, followed by a skeleton underwater representing the long‑ignored person. This template illustrates neglected responsibilities and misaligned priorities, especially when something serious is ignored in favor of trivial distractions.

memes.name: Megamind peeking
memes.semantic_description: Close crop of Megamind’s blue face peeking from below or behind an edge, eyes wide and slightly mischievous, as if secretly watching something. The template is used to depict someone quietly lurking, observing drama or content without participating.

memes.name: They're The Same Picture
memes.semantic_description: Frame from The Office where Pam sits at a desk holding two printed photos while a caption says the boss wants her to find the difference, followed by her deadpan conclusion that 'they're the same picture.' The template shows that two seemingly different things are effectively identical.

memes.name: This Is Where I'd Put My Trophy If I Had One
memes.semantic_description: Cartoon of a muscular character pointing angrily at an empty display shelf while declaring where he would place his trophy if he had one. The meme template expresses lack of recognition, zero wins, or having nothing to show despite effort.

memes.name: Is This A Pigeon
memes.semantic_description: Anime frame showing a bespectacled man in a suit holding his hand out toward a butterfly while asking 'Is this a pigeon?'. The template is used for mislabeling or misunderstanding concepts, especially when someone confidently identifies something in a completely wrong way.

memes.name: Monkey Puppet
memes.semantic_description: Two frames of a brown monkey puppet: first looking straight ahead with a neutral expression, then glancing sideways with wide eyes. The template conveys awkwardness and being caught off guard or guilty when someone realizes they’re implicated in what’s being talked about.

memes.name: Oprah You Get A
memes.semantic_description: Stage shot of Oprah Winfrey mid‑gesture, excitedly pointing at the audience during her famous giveaway episode. The template is used to show something being generously or indiscriminately given to everyone—good or bad—like features, bugs, or consequences.

memes.name: Hide the Pain Harold
memes.semantic_description: Photo of an older man at a desk holding a mug, smiling stiffly with eyes that look subtly strained. The template expresses pretending to be fine or happy despite discomfort, sadness, or burnout, especially in professional or social contexts.

memes.name: You Guys are Getting Paid
memes.semantic_description: Image of a man leaning forward with a confused, incredulous expression, commonly captioned with 'You guys are getting paid?'. The meme is used to highlight unfairness or exploitation, especially when someone realizes others are compensated while they are not.

memes.name: Squidward window
memes.semantic_description: Shot from SpongeBob where Squidward looks sadly out his window while SpongeBob and Patrick play joyfully outside in the sun. The template embodies FOMO—watching others enjoy something while you remain left out or stuck inside.

memes.name: This Is Fine
memes.semantic_description: Comic panel of a little dog sitting calmly at a table with a mug while the entire room around it is engulfed in flames. The dog’s resigned expression and the line 'This is fine' capture coping through denial or forced calm in the middle of clear disaster.

memes.name: Laughing Leo
memes.semantic_description: Still of Leonardo DiCaprio reclining in a chair with a drink and a cigarette, leaning forward and pointing at the TV while laughing. This template captures the moment of recognizing something on screen and mockingly laughing at it, ideal for 'calling out' relatable behavior.

memes.name: Clown Applying Makeup
memes.semantic_description: Four sequential photos of a man gradually putting on clown makeup, wig, and outfit until he becomes a full clown. The meme is used to show how a series of decisions or rationalizations slowly turns someone into a clown—embarrassing themselves with each added step.

memes.name: AJ Styles & Undertaker
memes.semantic_description: Promotional shot from WWE where AJ Styles stands in the foreground while The Undertaker looms menacingly behind him in a dark, graveyard‑like setting. The template emphasizes a cocky or vulnerable figure being overshadowed by a terrifying, unstoppable opponent or consequence.

memes.name: Flex Tape
memes.semantic_description: Infomercial clip where a man slaps a strip of Flex Tape onto a large tank spraying water, instantly stopping the leak. The template humorously depicts superficial, hacky, or rushed fixes applied to serious underlying problems.

memes.name: Boardroom Meeting Suggestion
memes.semantic_description: Four‑panel cartoon of a boss at the head of a table asking for ideas, employees offering suggestions, and the employee who gives the sensible idea being thrown out of a skyscraper window. It’s used to mock environments where constructive feedback or good ideas are punished instead of rewarded.

memes.name: Pawn Stars Best I Can Do
memes.semantic_description: Image of Rick Harrison behind the counter in Pawn Stars with a mildly unimpressed expression, commonly captioned 'Best I can do is…'. This meme template represents underwhelming offers, lowball negotiations, or companies refusing reasonable requests.

memes.name: Absolute Cinema
memes.semantic_description: Template referencing the phrase 'absolute cinema,' typically contrasting mundane or low‑effort scenes with hyperbolic critical praise. It’s used to ironically elevate trivial, cringe, or everyday content as if it were high art.

memes.name: They don't know
memes.semantic_description: Simple cartoon of a person at a party holding a red cup, standing apart while thinking 'They don’t know…' about some niche fact or personal situation, as the other guests chat happily. The template encapsulates feeling isolated, underrated, or secretly proud of something others don’t notice.

memes.name: Blank Nut Button
memes.semantic_description: Close‑up of a hand slamming down on a large, illuminated red button. The template is used to represent an instinctive or irresistible decision, often labeling the button with something impulsive or chaotic that someone just can’t resist doing.

memes.name: Soldier protecting sleeping child
memes.semantic_description: Illustration of a soldier lying between a sleeping child and a barrage of knives, bullets, and weapons raining down from above, physically shielding the bed. This template symbolizes unseen protection and sacrifice, often used to show infra teams, parents, or boring processes protecting users from hostile forces.

memes.name: Spider Man Triple
memes.semantic_description: Variation on the Spider‑Man pointing meme featuring three Spider‑Men standing in a triangle, each pointing at the others. It is used to show three identical or highly similar groups accusing each other of the same behavior or trait.

memes.name: Bell Curve
memes.semantic_description: Diagram of an IQ bell curve with a smug, simple character on the low end, a stressed nerd in the middle, and an enlightened robed figure on the high end, all labeled with different statements. The template shows how naive and very advanced perspectives can converge on a similar idea, while mid‑level understanding overcomplicates things.

memes.name: Types of Headaches meme
memes.semantic_description: Medical diagram showing several heads with red highlighted areas representing different headache types (tension, migraine, cluster) and a final panel repurposed to illustrate a custom 'headache' caused by a modern annoyance. It’s used to visualize how one specific situation causes disproportionate mental pain.

memes.name: Roll Safe Think About It
memes.semantic_description: Photo of a man in a leather jacket smirking and tapping his finger to his temple as if he’s had a clever thought. The template is used to mock flawed but self‑satisfied 'smart' logic, life hacks, or loopholes that only work technically.

memes.name: where monkey
memes.semantic_description: Cartoonish template in which a character appears confused and is paired with the phrase 'where monkey,' used to humorously express confusion or disappointment that a particular expected element is missing from a situation.

memes.name: All My Homies Hate
memes.semantic_description: Photo of a group of young men posing in a neighborhood street, commonly captioned 'All my homies hate X.' This template expresses exaggerated group hatred or mutual disdain for a particular thing, trend, or person.

memes.name: Panik Kalm Panik
memes.semantic_description: Three‑panel meme of a stylized humanoid head that starts in a panic, then relaxes into a calm, composed version after some reassurance, and finally returns to an even more intense panic when the reassurance fails. It’s used to depict a brief, false sense of security before realizing the situation is actually worse.

memes.name: Whisper and Goosebumps
memes.semantic_description: Split image with one side showing someone whispering intimately into another person’s ear, and the other side showing skin with raised goosebumps. The meme template visualizes a statement so powerful, intense, or emotionally resonant that it literally gives someone goosebumps.

memes.name: Two guys on a bus
memes.semantic_description: Cartoon of two men sitting on opposite sides of a bus as it drives along a cliff: one stares sadly at a gray rock wall, while the other smiles at a bright, scenic valley view. This template is used to show how perspective or mindset changes the emotional experience of the same situation.

memes.name: George Bush 9/11
memes.semantic_description: Historic photo of George W. Bush in a classroom holding a children’s book while an aide whispers urgent news in his ear, his face showing strained composure. The template is used to portray someone trying to maintain calm or pretend nothing is wrong while receiving catastrophic information.

memes.name: Sleeping Shaq
memes.semantic_description: Two images of Shaquille O’Neal: one shows him lying down with eyes closed, labeled with indifference to something, and the other shows his eyes artificially glowing bright, representing extreme alertness to something else. It’s used to contrast what people ignore versus what truly wakes them up.

memes.name: Friendship ended
memes.semantic_description: Heavily edited Pakistani friendship poster with one person’s face crossed out and a new friend highlighted alongside text like 'Friendship ended with X. Now Y is my best friend.' This template dramatizes switching allegiances from one thing to another.

memes.name: Three-headed Dragon
memes.semantic_description: Fantasy illustration of a three‑headed dragon where two heads look fierce and intimidating, while the third has a goofy, derpy expression and droopy tongue. This template shows three options or members in a category where two are serious or powerful and one is laughably incompetent.

memes.name: Inhaling Seagull
memes.semantic_description: Four panels of a seagull perched on a railing: first neutrally standing, then leaning back to inhale, then stretching its neck and finally screaming with its beak wide open. The template is used to represent a phrase being repeated louder and more intensely, often escalating from a quiet thought to a full‑on screaming chant.

memes.name: Megamind no bitches
memes.semantic_description: Close‑up of Megamind leaning toward the viewer with narrowed eyes and a smug, mocking expression, popularly captioned with 'no bitches?' or similar roasts. It’s used as a harsh but humorous call‑out when someone’s behavior suggests social failure or cringe priorities.

memes.name: A train hitting a school bus
memes.semantic_description: Diagram‑like meme showing a massive train colliding violently with a small yellow school bus. The template is used to visualize an overwhelming force or trend smashing into a vulnerable target—like reality vs expectations, big tech vs indie devs, or deadlines vs mental health.

memes.name: Grant Gustin over grave
memes.semantic_description: Photo of actor Grant Gustin kneeling and posing cheerfully next to a gravestone, sometimes giving a peace sign, clearly celebrating in front of a grave. This template depicts reveling in the death or end of something—like a trend, feature, or competitor product.

memes.name: Trump Bill Signing
memes.semantic_description: Photo of Donald Trump seated at a desk holding up a signed document to the camera while officials stand behind him. The template is used to show someone proudly formalizing or taking responsibility for a policy, change, or rule—often something controversial or silly.

memes.name: Anime Girl Hiding from Terminator
memes.semantic_description: Composite image with an anime girl hiding fearfully behind a doorway while a Terminator‑like robot approaches from the other side. It’s used to show a fragile or vulnerable entity terrified of a relentless threat, such as small creators vs big platforms or fragile systems vs traffic spikes.

memes.name: Leonardo Dicaprio Cheers
memes.semantic_description: Frame from The Great Gatsby where Leonardo DiCaprio, in a tuxedo, raises a champagne glass toward the camera with a knowing smile. This template is used to toast or congratulate something or someone, sometimes sincerely and sometimes with ironic distance.

memes.name: Grandma Finds The Internet
memes.semantic_description: Photo of an elderly woman wearing glasses, seated at a laptop, peering at the screen with a bemused, slightly confused smile. The template is used to illustrate generational tech gaps, naive misunderstandings of online culture, or very basic questions about technology.

memes.name: Surprised Pikachu
memes.semantic_description: Zoomed‑in anime frame of Pikachu with its mouth slightly open and eyes wide, conveying mild surprise. The meme is used when someone is shocked by an outcome that was entirely predictable based on their actions.

memes.name: Futurama Fry
memes.semantic_description: Close‑up of Fry from Futurama squinting with a suspicious, uncertain expression against a blue background. The template is used with 'Not sure if X or Y' to express ambiguity between two possible interpretations of a situation.

memes.name: Scooby doo mask reveal
memes.semantic_description: Scooby‑Doo style comic where a villain is tied up and Fred pulls off their mask to reveal their true identity underneath, often surprising the gang. The template is used to show that something blamed on one cause is actually due to another hidden factor.

memes.name: Father and Son Screaming Match
memes.semantic_description: Tall meme built from a reality TV show where an older man and a younger man scream at each other across a table, with escalating body language and anger. The template captures a back‑and‑forth argument that spirals out of control, often used for generational or hierarchical conflicts.

memes.name: Disappointed Black Guy
memes.semantic_description: Two‑frame reaction image of the same man: first smiling widely in delight, then abruptly looking blank and disappointed. The template is used to show expectations being raised and then immediately dashed by reality.

memes.name: No - Yes
memes.semantic_description: Two-panel drawing where a character holds a 'NO' sign with a stern expression, then flips it to 'YES' in the second panel with a resigned or changed attitude. It captures reluctant agreement or giving in after initially refusing.

memes.name: Finding Neverland
memes.semantic_description: Scene from Finding Neverland with an adult gently explaining something serious to a child on a bench, while the child listens with a sad but accepting expression. The template is used when breaking difficult truths in a soft, emotional way.

memes.name: Grim Reaper Knocking Door
memes.semantic_description: Comic strip of the Grim Reaper walking down a corridor, leaving bloody doors behind as he knocks on the next one. The template is used to represent a sequence of people, apps, or trends that are being 'killed off' one after another by the same force.

memes.name: The Rock Driving
memes.semantic_description: Two‑panel meme with Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson driving a car: first calmly looking at the road and speaking, then whipping his head around in shock at something the passenger says. It’s used for setups where a seemingly normal question gets an absurd or alarming answer.

memes.name: is this butterfly
memes.semantic_description: Alternate cropping of the 'Is this a pigeon?' anime scene where the character misidentifies a butterfly, used to humorously depict mistaken classification or clueless labeling of concepts.

memes.name: Two Paths
memes.semantic_description: Minimal cartoon showing a cloaked figure standing at a fork in a forested road where a single path splits into two distinctly labeled paths. The meme template encodes mutually exclusive choices or ideological splits, used to represent diverging approaches.

memes.name: spiderman pointing at spiderman
memes.semantic_description: Classic cartoon panel from Spider‑Man where two identically costumed Spider‑Men stand in an alley pointing accusingly at each other. This template is used to represent hypocrisy, projection, or identical entities accusing each other of the same behavior.

memes.name: whe i'm in a competition and my opponent is
memes.semantic_description: Reaction meme contrasting a normal or underwhelming self with an opponent who appears absurdly strong, skilled, or intimidating. It encapsulates feeling outclassed or overwhelmed in a competition or comparison.

memes.name: Doakes
memes.semantic_description: Close‑up screenshot of Sergeant Doakes from Dexter staring intensely with wide eyes and slightly open mouth, as if saying 'I knew it!' The meme is used to convey sudden confirmation of long‑held suspicion and confrontational energy.

memes.name: The Scroll Of Truth
memes.semantic_description: Cartoon of an adventurer discovering an ancient scroll labeled with some uncomfortable truth, reading it, then angrily throwing it away into a dark cave. It’s used to show people rejecting factual but inconvenient information.

memes.name: Gus Fring we are not the same
memes.semantic_description: Image of Gus Fring from Breaking Bad looking composed and professional, paired with text contrasting his high standards and discipline with someone else’s lower standards under the line 'We are not the same.' The template is used to flex superior habits, ethics, or quality.

memes.name: Charlie Conspiracy (Always Sunny in Philidelphia)
memes.semantic_description: Scene from It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia where Charlie stands in front of a corkboard covered with papers and red strings, furiously gesturing while explaining a convoluted theory. The template visualizes obsessive overanalysis, conspiracy‑style thinking, and absurdly complicated explanations.
